description: President Donald Trump will attend the 2017 National Rifle Association annual meeting in Atlanta, Georgia in April 27-30 2017.
title: Donald Trump attends NRA convention 2017 in Atlanta
title_page: Photos: Donald Trump attends NRA convention 2017 in Atlanta
text:
1 / 22
HYOSUB SHIN / AJC April 29, 2017 Atlanta - President Donald Trump speeks during NRA-ILA Leadership Forum at Georgia World Congress Center on Friday, April 29, 2017. NRA-ILA Leadership Forum with keynote speaker President Donald J. Trump Guest Speakers. HYOSUB SHIN / HSHIN@AJC.COM
2 / 22
HYOSUB SHIN / AJC April 29, 2017 Atlanta - before NRA-ILA Leadership Forum at Georgia World Congress Center on Friday, April 29, 2017. NRA-ILA Leadership Forum with keynote speaker President Donald J. Trump Guest Speakers. HYOSUB SHIN / HSHIN@AJC.COM
3 / 22
HYOSUB SHIN / AJC April 29, 2017 Atlanta - President Donald Trump speeks during NRA-ILA Leadership Forum at Georgia World Congress Center on Friday, April 29, 2017. NRA-ILA Leadership Forum with keynote speaker President Donald J. Trump Guest Speakers. HYOSUB SHIN / HSHIN@AJC.COM
4 / 22
ccompton@ajc.com/Curtis Compton April 28, 2017, Atlanta: Executive Director of the NRA Wayne LaPierre (right) and Executive Director of the NRA Institute for Legislative Action Chris Cox introduce President Donald J. Trump at the NRA-ILA Leadership Forum on Friday, April 28, 2017, in Atlanta. Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com
5 / 22
ccompton@ajc.com/Curtis Compton President Donald J. Trump delivers the keynote at the NRA-ILA Leadership Forum on Friday, April 28, 2017, in Atlanta, Georgia. Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com
6 / 22
ccompton@ajc.com/Curtis Compton April 28, 2017, Atlanta: Thousands of NRA members snap photos as Executive Director of the NRA Wayne LaPierre (right) and Executive Director of the NRA Institute for Legislative Action Chris Cox introduce President Donald J. Trump for his keynote at the NRA-ILA Leadership Forum on Friday, April 28, 2017, in Atlanta. Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com
7 / 22
HYOSUB SHIN / AJC/hshin@ajc.com Workers put the finishing touches on the convention floor at the Georgia World Congress Center in preparation for The 146th NRA Annual Meetings and Exhibits in Atlanta on Wednesday, April 26, 2017. More than 80,000 people are set to attend the NRA convention, which kicks off in Atlanta on Thursday evening and continues through Sunday. HYOSUB SHIN / HSHIN@AJC.COM
8 / 22
ccompton@ajc.com/Curtis Compton April 28, 2017, Atlanta: Attendees begin to arrive for a keynote by President Donald J. Trump at the NRA-ILA Leadership Forum on Friday, April 28, 2017, in Atlanta. Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com
9 / 22
HYOSUB SHIN / AJC April 29, 2017 Atlanta - before NRA-ILA Leadership Forum at Georgia World Congress Center on Friday, April 29, 2017. NRA-ILA Leadership Forum with keynote speaker President Donald J. Trump Guest Speakers. HYOSUB SHIN / HSHIN@AJC.COM
10 / 22
ccompton@ajc.com/Curtis Compton April 28, 2017, Atlanta: NRA attendees Bill and Karen Geittman, Herrin, IL, watch a video of President Donald Trump while waiting for him to arrive for a keynote at the NRA-ILA Leadership Forum on Friday, April 28, 2017, in Atlanta. Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com
11 / 22
HYOSUB SHIN / AJC April 29, 2017 Atlanta - before NRA-ILA Leadership Forum at Georgia World Congress Center on Friday, April 29, 2017. NRA-ILA Leadership Forum with keynote speaker President Donald J. Trump Guest Speakers. HYOSUB SHIN / HSHIN@AJC.COM
12 / 22
HYOSUB SHIN / AJC April 29, 2017 Atlanta - before NRA-ILA Leadership Forum at Georgia World Congress Center on Friday, April 29, 2017. NRA-ILA Leadership Forum with keynote speaker President Donald J. Trump Guest Speakers. HYOSUB SHIN / HSHIN@AJC.COM
13 / 22
ccompton@ajc.com/Curtis Compton April 28, 2017, Atlanta: NRA attendees go through security before entering the hall for a keynote by President Donald J. Trump at the NRA-ILA Leadership Forum on Friday, April 28, 2017, in Atlanta. Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com
14 / 22
ccompton@ajc.com/Curtis Compton April 28, 2017, Atlanta: Security is tight for attendees to enter the hall for a keynote by President Donald J. Trump at the NRA-ILA Leadership Forum on Friday, April 28, 2017, in Atlanta. Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com
15 / 22
ccompton@ajc.com/Curtis Compton April 28, 2017, Atlanta: Country music recording artist Michael Ray performs for the audience before a keynote by President Donald J. Trump at the NRA-ILA Leadership Forum on Friday, April 28, 2017, in Atlanta. Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com
16 / 22
HYOSUB SHIN / AJC/hshin@ajc.com April 26, 2017 Atlanta - Workers put the finishing touches on the convention floor at the Georgia World Congress Center in preparation for The 146th NRA Annual Meetings and Exhibits in Atlanta on Wednesday, April 26, 2017. More than 80,000 people are set to attend the NRA convention, which kicks off in Atlanta on Thursday evening and continues through Sunday. HYOSUB SHIN / HSHIN@AJC.COM
17 / 22
ccompton@ajc.com/Curtis Compton April 27, 2017, Atlanta: The stage is set and tested for the keynote by President Donald J. Trump at the National Rifle Association Leadership Forum in the Georgia World Congress Center on Thursday, April 27, 2017, in Atlanta. Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com
18 / 22
HYOSUB SHIN / AJC/hshin@ajc.com April 27, 2017 Atlanta - Mike Miller, of Jackson, sets up a rifle scope to AR15 at the Georgia World Congress Center in preparation for The 146th NRA Annual Meetings and Exhibits in Atlanta on Thursday, April 27, 2017. The National Rifle Association's annual convention, today through Sunday in downtown Atlanta, features an address by President Donald Trump, a concert by Hank Williams Jr. and 10 acres of firearms and shooting and hunting gear. HYOSUB SHIN / HSHIN@AJC.COM
19 / 22
HYOSUB SHIN / AJC/hshin@ajc.com April 27, 2017 Atlanta - An early crowd heads down at the Georgia World Congress Center in preparation for The 146th NRA Annual Meetings and Exhibits in Atlanta on Thursday, April 27, 2017. The National Rifle Association's annual convention, today through Sunday in downtown Atlanta, features an address by President Donald Trump, a concert by Hank Williams Jr. and 10 acres of firearms and shooting and hunting gear. HYOSUB SHIN / HSHIN@AJC.COM
20 / 22
ccompton@ajc.com/Curtis Compton April 27, 2017, Atlanta: Attendees pass by a large banner advertising a handgun during the NRA convention at the Georgia World Congress Center on Thursday, April 27, 2017, in Atlanta. President Donald J. Trump will keynote the National Rifle Association Leadership Forum at the convention on Friday. Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com
21 / 22
HYOSUB SHIN / AJC/hshin@ajc.com April 27, 2017 Atlanta - An early crowd gathers at registration area at the Georgia World Congress Center in preparation for The 146th NRA Annual Meetings and Exhibits in Atlanta on Thursday, April 27, 2017. The National Rifle Association's annual convention, today through Sunday in downtown Atlanta, features an address by President Donald Trump, a concert by Hank Williams Jr. and 10 acres of firearms and shooting and hunting gear. HYOSUB SHIN / HSHIN@AJC.COM
